intro: Kosteletzkya pentacarpos, commonly known as the five-seed mercurial, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by distinctive, five-lobed capsules containing five seeds. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, making it an adaptable and resilient species.
